wp:term.wp:term_description: Recipient was mentioned in an activity update.
A member has replied to an activity update that the recipient posted.
A member has replied to a comment on an activity update that the recipient posted.
A site member has sent a site invitation to the recipient.
Recipient has successfully activated an account.
Recipient has registered for an account.
Recipient has registered for an account and site.
A member has sent a friend request to the recipient.
Recipient has had a friend request accepted by a member.
Recipient was mentioned in a group activity update.
A member has sent a group invitation to the recipient.
Recipient's status within a group has changed.
A member has requested permission to join a group.
Recipient had requested to join a group, which was accepted.
Recipient had requested to join a group, which was rejected.
Recipient has received a private message.
Recipient has changed their email address.

item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded:
{{poster.name}} replied to one of your updates:
"{{usermessage}}"
Go to the discussion to reply or catch up on the conversation.

item.content:encoded:

"{{usermessage}}"
Go to the discussion to reply or catch up on the conversation.

Go to the discussion to reply or catch up on the conversation.

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Activate your account
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: Thanks for registering! To complete the activation of your account, go to the following link and click on the Activate button: {{{activate.url}}} If the 'Activation Key' field is empty, copy and paste the following into the field - {{key}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Activate {{{user-site.url}}}
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: Thanks for registering! To complete the activation of your account and site, go to the following link: {{{activate-site.url}}}. After you activate, you can visit your site at {{{user-site.url}}}.

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] New friendship request from {{initiator.name}}
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: {{initiator.name}} wants to add you as a friend. To accept this request and manage all of your pending requests, visit: {{{friend-requests.url}}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] {{friend.name}} accepted your friendship request
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: {{friend.name}} accepted your friend request.
item.excerpt:encoded:
{{friend.name}} accepted your friend request.
To learn more about them, visit their profile: {{{friendship.url}}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Group details updated
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded:
Group details for the group "{{group.name}}" were updated:
{{changed_text}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] You have an invitation to the group: "{{group.name}}"
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: {{inviter.name}} has invited you to join the group: "{{group.name}}". {{invite.message}} Go here to accept your invitation or visit the group to learn more.

item.dc:creator: MetaFans

item.excerpt:encoded:
You have been promoted to {{promoted_to}} in the group: "{{group.name}}".
To visit the group, go to: {{{group.url}}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Membership request for group: {{group.name}}
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: {{requesting-user.name}} wants to join the group "{{group.name}}". {{request.message}} As you are an administrator of this group, you must either accept or reject the membership request. Go here to manage this and all other pending requests.

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] New message from {{sender.name}}
item.dc:creator: MetaFans

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Verify your new email address
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: You recently changed the email address associated with your account on {{site.name}} to {{user.email}}. If this is correct, go here to confirm the change. Otherwise, you can safely ignore and delete this email if you have changed your mind, or if you think you have received this email in error.
item.excerpt:encoded:
You recently changed the email address associated with your account on {{site.name}} to {{user.email}}. If this is correct, go to the following link to confirm the change: {{{verify.url}}}
Otherwise, you can safely ignore and delete this email if you have changed your mind, or if you think you have received this email in error.

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Membership request for group "{{group.name}}" accepted
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: Your membership request for the group "{{group.name}}" has been accepted.
item.excerpt:encoded:
Your membership request for the group "{{group.name}}" has been accepted.
To view the group, visit: {{{group.url}}}

item.title: [{{{site.name}}}] Membership request for group "{{group.name}}" rejected
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: Your membership request for the group "{{group.name}}" has been rejected.
item.excerpt:encoded:
Your membership request for the group "{{group.name}}" has been rejected.
To request membership again, visit: {{{group.url}}}

item.title: New Post
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded:
Write New Post

Start a conversation, ask a question or share your idea.

Visit the Help Center for MetaFans technical or platform support questions.

Tips on Posting

  • Be as specific as possible in your post title, so other instructors know what you have a question about or want to discuss.
  • Pick the most relevant forum for your post. If youre not sure, make your best guess. A moderator can move the post for you if theres a better space for it.
  • Limit the number of photos, videos, and GIFs you include in one post. Too many visuals may make the page slow to load.
  • Read the latest news and announcements from MetaFans, and learn how to use the Instructor Community.

item.title: Help Center
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded:
• Frequently Asked Questions

Table of Contents

Privacy Policy VIP

Increase your VIP account by using the Paypal payment method automatically making subscription payments in your PayPal account. and this depends on the duration of the VIP package you choose.

We do not guarantee that all VIP file download links can be accessed (can be downloaded), but we will always try to keep the file links available.

If you have upgraded your VIP account and tried to download a file and it is not available, we are not responsible for any of that ... we also do not promise to update the File download link, but we will try to do our best to keep the link always available.

We do not accept a refund for the upgrade of the account even if you only take 15 minutes to use the VIP account.
For example, you upgrade your account to VIP at 00.00 and then ask us to make your account free at 00.30. and we can not do it and we do not provide a refund.

Automatic payments, if you have used a VIP account in the first month and automatically made payments in the second month without you knowing it, you can contact us at email: admin@metafans.me to do a Refund and make an account downgrade. and this is only valid 2 days after the automatic payment is made.
if you force a dispute on PayPal, we will ban your account and we will not make a refund.

Thank you very much

How To Register?

Please click the Register button and enter Name, Active Email, Password, Date of Birth, and Country, After that click the Register button.

After you will receive an Email and Click Activate or Confirm.

How to Make a Thread?

To make your first Thread, please click on the Introduction of New Members category, right under the Lobby and Click button POST THREAD

How to Upgrade Account?

Please click Premium on the Website Menu and adjust the package you want then click the button PURCHASE

Please note: we only accept Paypal payments.

Your account will be upgraded for a maximum of 24 hours
to speed up the upgrade action please Inbox to MetaFans Team

item.content:encoded:
Newest Topics

DarkRice Posted in : Study Tips
Would you like to find a study buddy or group?
A big reason we created this community space is so you could connect with other people learning on MetaFans. We know its not always easy 1 Replies Demo User1 month, 1 week ago Orbit X Posted in : Networking & Social Discussion

Hi, Im the Lead Mentor for a medium-large MetaFans course. With my professor, Im starting a study of whether participation in a course forum is 2 Replies Demo User4 months, 3 weeks ago MetaFans Posted in : Networking & Social Discussion

Welcome to our community! This is a place for MetaFans learners to connect with one another and help each other achieve their learning and life 0 Replies IamPseudoX Posted in : General Discussion

Today our Big Bunny, I mean Big Buddy @metafans turned 35 years :geek: The guy who added new taste to MetaFans community with group conversations, 1 Replies Demo User1 month ago SnowBell Posted in : News and Announcements

item.title: A new era for international associations there is no turning back!
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded:
What is an Online Community?

An online community is a group of people who interact with each other on an online platform. These communities can range from the 1+ billion-person Instagram community to a 10-person community of coffee lovers that rates artisan cafes in their city through a private Facebook group.

Theres a huge range in how an online community can scale, and understanding what type of online community is the most beneficial for your brand is the first step in building your own community.

Types of Online Communities

The type of online community that you choose to create is going to be the answer to the above question, what community does your customer want? Your artisan coffee community doesnt want to share their coffee tasting experiences with 1+ billion people. They want an intimate group of coffee lovers who know what theyre talking about and have a similar palette.

On the flip side, bloggers making a full-time living sharing their lifestyle are more than happy to try to grow their brands community as large as possible within the massive Instagram community of 1+ billion users.

There are two types of online communities:

1. Public social networks.

Think Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTokeven Vine (RIP) was a massive online community. Public social networks are online communities that only require someone to have an account to be part of the community. There arent many guidelines or restrictions when it comes to who gets to be part of this type of community.

2. Branded communities.

This type of community is the opposite of a public social network. Youll need to provide more than an email address and password to get inside of the community. Imagine SOHO house, or a private members club, but online. Youll need the right credentials (experience, common interests, location, etc.) to have access to the communityeven if its on a public social media platform.
item.excerpt:encoded: Theres a huge range in how an online community can scale, and understanding what type of online community is the most beneficial for your brand is the first step in building your own community.

item.title: How to Choose the Best Domain Name (Tips and Tools)
item.dc:creator: stephane maarek
item.content:encoded:
Choosing the right domain name for your website is crucial for your success. If you choose the wrong domain name, then it can be a hassle to switch later on without hurting your brand and search rankings.
Thats why its extremely important that you choose the best domain name from the start.
When first starting out, it can be hard to come up with catchy business name ideas with a perfect domain name.
In this article, well share all the tools and tips you need to get domain name ideas, choose the best domain name, and register your new domain (for free).

item.title: Warning Note for Envato Elements Sellers !!
item.dc:creator: josephphillips
item.content:encoded: Since the last day we are dealing with several reports regarding misleading sales, thread titles including taking payments in advance from buyers in name of 60 days / 90 days customers. Even one of our staff members appeared to be the victim of it HENCE! All the Envato Elements sellers should abide by the following rules: Thread title + contents + refund policy should strictly be limited to only 30 days account which Envato officially offers via giveaway. Everything A-Z should be clearly stated to the interested buyers before proceeding with the sale. There should no way be any kind of 60 days / 90 days or so on kind of shits, or taking payments in advance by any kind of excuses like pay extra, I will renew next month free etc blah blah blah. Nothing nowhere, even by directing customers to other platforms for deals. Means should be only 30 days sells by maintaining all the required ruleset policies. I (including other staff members) will mention a few sellers names here to give them a warning in advance . . All the mentioned as well as other selling thread holders should edit their thread as soon as possible. After being active, and neglecting this warning will simply lead us to click some random buttons beside your profile name to make you guys disappear from here (get it clear what I mean) . . . Thats all . . Violating will cause the profile to be Banned permanently, even if we find multiple violations we will Blacklist/prohibit Envato elements selling just like cracked Netflix, Edu based google drive sells. TO REFRAIN THE THREAD FROM UNNECESSARY DISCUSSIONS IT WILL REMAIN CLOSED WHILE MENTIONING SELLERS BY MODS WILL GO ON . . .

item.title: New to the community? Introduce yourself here! [January 2021]
item.dc:creator: MetaFans
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our community! This is a place for MetaFans learners to connect with one another and help each other achieve their learning and life goals. We'd love to get to know you a bit better, so please reply to this post to introduce yourself! Here are a few ideas: 1. Where you're from or where you live now 2. What you're studying 3. Why you're studying 4. What your hobbies or interests are 5. What youd like to get out of this community Most of our community forums have their own introduction threads, so if youre interested in a particular subject, be sure to check those out. - MetaFans Community Manager

item.title: Research on forum participation as a predictor of course completion
item.dc:creator: orbit x
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Im the Lead Mentor for a medium-large MetaFans course. With my professor, Im starting a study of whether participation in a course forum is a predictor of course completion. By participation, I mean not only posting, upvoting, and/or and replying to posts, but also reading posts without reacting to them at all (lurking).

I posted a thread asking our learners what they thought of the forums. Many replied that they like to read them and that they learn from them, but that they do not post themselves because of language barriers. And we know from social media in general that only a small percentage of people who read a post react or respond to it. Most people lurk.

The primary question will be whether people who post, react, or even lurk are more likely to complete the course than those who do not engage with the forums.

My early findings are that there is little relationship between posting in forums and course completion, but I was only looking at people who post or reply, not at lurkers, who constitute the majority of forum users. Im not sure I can get at this data with the datasets we have received from MetaFans, so Im starting a review of the literature to see whether there are any findings from other platforms or from social media.

The secondary question will be whether receiving reactions to a post makes a learner more likely to produce further posts and replies, thereby enlarging the discussion and enriching the content. If the answer to the first question turns out to be positive, then encouraging people to post more often (through direct cues in the course, which we already do) might indirectly increase course completion.

Right now, Im seeing between 50-100 replies per day to the cued threads.Nearly all posts receive at least an upvote and most get a short response.

Our completion rate is running about double that of a companion course that does not have active mentoring. But i need to tease out whether active mentoring is encouraging forum participation and thereby leading to our enhanced completion rate because it is frankly a lot of work.

I would appreciate any thoughts and opinions, and also references to any literature on these topics as I start my review of lit.

Thanks for reading this long thread!

item.title: Would you like to find a study buddy or group?
item.dc:creator: darkrice
item.content:encoded:
A big reason we created this community space is so you could connect with other people learning on MetaFans. We know it's not always easy to find each other, especially if you aren't in the same course session. Inspired by @Jessey M's post, "How can I find people taking the same courses in same area for a study group?," I want to ask you all this question.
When we have a global community like this and over 3,000 courses in the catalog, it's such a good question. How do you find people in your area taking the same courses?

protected function validateForm() {
		if (!$this->user->hasPermission('modify', 'ticket/status')) {
			$this->error['warning'] = $this->language->get('error_permission');
		}
		foreach ($this->request->post['ticket_status_description'] as $language_id => $value) {
			if ((utf8_strlen($value['name']) < 2) || (utf8_strlen($value['name']) > 255)) {
				$this->error['name'][$language_id] = $this->language->get('error_name');
			}
		}
		return !$this->error;
	}
